physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Prenatal bradycardia and severe neonatal hypoglycemia. No signs of sepsis detected at birth.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At age 12, hematocrit was 62%, hemoglobin was 19.8 g/dl, indicating a progression of erythrocytosis.

physical_examinations.date: At genetic diagnosis (12 years of age)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Abnormal cardiac rhythm with bigeminal and trigeminal pulses and supraventricular premature beats.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The patient's cardiac rhythm abnormalities persisted without requiring treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Continued issues with blood glucose levels and reticulocyte count of 175,000 cells/Î¼l. HDL cholesterol level was low at 31 mg/dl.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hematocrit decreased from 62% at 12 years to 55.5% at 22 years.
